description: Purchases a Reserved Instance for use with your account. With Reserved Instances, you pay a lower hourly rate compared to On-Demand instance pricing. Use  DescribeReservedInstancesOfferings to get a list of Reserved Instance offerings that match your specifications. After you've purchased a Reserved Instance, you can check for your new Reserved Instance with  DescribeReservedInstances. To queue a purchase for a future date and time, specify a purchase time. If you do not specify a purchase time, the default is the current time. For more information, see Reserved Instances and Sell in the Reserved Instance Marketplace in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

parameters.name: InstanceCount
parameters.description: The number of Reserved Instances to purchase.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesOfferingId
parameters.description: The ID of the Reserved Instance offering to purchase.

parameters.name: LimitPrice
parameters.description: Specified for Reserved Instance Marketplace offerings to limit the total order and ensure that the Reserved Instances are not purchased at unexpected prices. Amount (float) --- Used for Reserved Instance Marketplace offerings. Specifies the limit price on the total order (instanceCount * price). CurrencyCode (string) --- The currency in which the limitPrice amount is specified. At this time, the only supported currency is USD.

nested_params.name: Amount
nested_params.description: Used for Reserved Instance Marketplace offerings. Specifies the limit price on the total order (instanceCount * price).

nested_params.name: CurrencyCode
nested_params.description: The currency in which the limitPrice amount is specified. At this time, the only supported currency is USD.

nested_items.name: ReservedInstancesId
nested_items.description: The IDs of the purchased Reserved Instances. If your purchase crosses into a discounted pricing tier, the final Reserved Instances IDs might change. For more information, see Crossing pricing tiers in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
